"You're no longer passive recipients of knowledge...to implement with fidelity," Bryk says to #teachers. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"This work needs active, full engagement of teacher-leaders." Anthony Bryk says. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon #education
We need coordinated, collected action, including a range of experts: #teachers, #edadmin...Bryk says. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
Building Teaching Effectiveness Network's initial hunch was #ntchat issues a school-based issue, Bryk says. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"Learning from failures has two big implications...," Bryk says. Start small, be deliberate in efforts. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
RT @NoelCandelaria: Anthony Bryk: "We don't need more people at end of assembly line counting all the defects...go up and find real issue t…
Byrk emphasizes "productive persistence," or maintaining students' positive mindsets, starting strong, etc. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"We need to get data at the level where we may actually change it," says Byrk on analysing edu processes. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
Primary system failures: Language barrier, disengagement, losing students in course transition, Byrk says. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"Failures are typically a function of the system," Byrk says. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO  #neafcon #edreform
Need to see all factions: Student supports, materials, #edpolicy, data infrastructure, and HR, says Bryk. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"We're not alone in seeing these kinds of outcomes," Bryk says on variation in performance of public edu. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
"What is the specific problem we're trying to solve?" Bryk asks, encouraging us not to jump to a solution. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO #neafcon
Our aspirations for public education are rising, while performance also rises, says Bryk. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO @CarnegieFdn #neafcon
Anthony Bryk discusses complexity of #education system, infrastructure. http://t.co/eg0Z1kS4JO @CarnegieFdn #neafcon http://t.co/M5hdj2bOlp
